newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican stocks close down, but off lows.
newsitem.headline: Mexican stocks close down, but off lows.

text.p: Mexican stocks petered out on Friday after a week of record highs gave way to a session of profit-taking, although prices made up some ground toward the close of trade after falling through support levels.
The IPC index of leading stocks fell 24.96 points or 0.74 percent to 3,364.37.
"The market was very weak. Most of the people paid to see what was going on and got out early," one floor trader said.
Traders said the fact that stocks bottomed out at the 3,332 resistance level and rebounded was a good sign that stocks are consolidating in preparation to rise again.
But volume was very low at 62.57 million shares in 2,708 transactions. Losers outpaced gainers 51 to 31.

Benchmark Telmex ADRs fell 3/8 to 33-3/4 while in Mexico Telmex L shares, the largest issue on the bolsa, fell 14 centavos or 1.09 percent to 12.70 pesos. Telmex A shares fell 1.25 percent or 16 centavos to 12.62 pesos.

Retailers took the biggest hit with Grupo Salinas y Rocha L shares topping the lists of losers .PL.MX by falling five percent or two centavos to 38 centavos. Gigante B followed, off 4.44 percent or 12 centavos to 2.58 pesos and Grupo Palacio de Hierro fell 3.85 percent or 20 centavos to 5 pesos.
